_header: X for Christs him self was dight
Note:
Cf. 1722, stanza 2, lines 5-6 and stanza 4, which Greene (1977)
XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977 (see also Greene (1935)
XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977), 361 identifies as the likely source for this poem.
_description: A song of X and M and I and E — five quatrains and burden: ‘Of X & M & oþer too / Of I & E I syng all so’

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
X for criste hym selfe was dythAs clerkys redyn in story
                    ryth…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines:
…to bryng us [ ] þe dewlys allWith hys d[ ]rede
                    alle
CamStJohn259.Note:
Ends imperfectly; fifth stanza deleted, only partially
                    recoverable.

Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
